I would recommend "Doctor Zhivago" which is a classic Russian novel that tells the story of a doctor who falls in love with the wife of his nemesis. The movie adaptation of this novel was released in 1965 and has become one of the most beloved movies of all time.

Another recommendation could be "Apocalypse Now," which is a classic Vietnam War film directed by Francis Ford Coppola. The movie tells the story of U.S. Army Captain Willard "Marshall" McCall who becomes obsessed with the mission to assassinate North Vietnamese leader Ho Chi Minh. The movie shows the brutal and chaotic conditions faced by soldiers in Vietnam, including their experiences with combat, food shortages, and cultural differences between American soldiers and Vietnamese civilians.

Overall, both "Doctor Zhivago" and "Apocalypse Now" are excellent movies that offer a unique perspective on important historical events and the human experience more broadly.
